definition: to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: Studies have confirmed that past immigration has become a cost factor for the economy.
sentences.chinese: 研究确认过去的移民已经成为经济的负累。

sentences.english: BingYin son is afraid to stay and become a negative tired, leave a book.
sentences.chinese: 丙寅为怕留下来成为儿子负累，便留书出走。

sentences.english: This type of code execution is punishing to a database.
sentences.chinese: 这类代码执行对于数据库来说是个负累。

sentences.english: Newcomers to an organization sometimes get stuck with work over and above their job description.
sentences.chinese: 新进人员有时候会被很多职责范围以外的工作所负累。

sentences.english: They think a kid is a burden and they enjoy less.
sentences.chinese: 他们认为生活已是负累，为什么还要添孩子。

definition: superfluous/cumbersome/a burden on sb/a nuisance to sb/to inconvenience/to tie sb down/long-winded (of writing)/also pr. [lei2 zhui5]
heavy load/heavy burden (also fig. of tax)
to have no cares/to be carefree
to worry about/to be concerned about
to bear/to carry on one's back/to shoulder
lit. fettered by fame and locked up by riches (idiom); tied down by reputation and wealth/the victim of one's own success
to be all alone in the world
